body_html:
I can print it either. But it takes much more time to print(bb) than print(aa).

  • pytorch version is 0.4.0
  • CPU: Xeon E5-2620 v4
  • Win10 LTSB 2015

=====================

  • a->aa, 0.0s
  • b->bb, 0.0010232925415039062s
  • print(aa), 0.8235607147216797s
  • print(bb), 72.6184949874878s

test script

import numpy as np
import torch
import time

a = np.random.randn(41, 288, 360, 3)
b = np.random.randint(10, size=(41, 288, 360, 3))

start = time.time()
aa = torch.from_numpy(a)
a_time = time.time() - start

start = time.time()
bb = torch.from_numpy(b)
b_time = time.time() - start

start = time.time()
print(aa)
aa_time = time.time() - start

start = time.time()
print(bb)
bb_time = time.time() - start

print(a_time, b_time, aa_time, bb_time)

body:
I can print it either. But it takes much more time to print(bb) than print(aa).

- pytorch version is 0.4.0
- CPU: Xeon E5-2620 v4
- Win10 LTSB 2015

=====================

- a->aa, 0.0s
- b->bb, 0.0010232925415039062s
- print(aa), 0.8235607147216797s
- print(bb), **72.6184949874878s**

## test script
```python
import numpy as np
import torch
import time

a = np.random.randn(41, 288, 360, 3)
b = np.random.randint(10, size=(41, 288, 360, 3))

start = time.time()
aa = torch.from_numpy(a)
a_time = time.time() - start

start = time.time()
bb = torch.from_numpy(b)
b_time = time.time() - start

start = time.time()
print(aa)
aa_time = time.time() - start

start = time.time()
print(bb)
bb_time = time.time() - start

print(a_time, b_time, aa_time, bb_time)
```
